revised_title: Evaluating Land-Use and Land-Treatment Practices in Semi-Arid Western US Rangelands
tldr: This article discusses the evaluation of land-use and land-treatment practices in semi-arid western United States rangelands. It highlights the importance of grazing control, vegetation modification, mechanical land treatments, and water spreaders in improving plant cover, controlling runoff and erosion, and managing water resources in arid and semi-arid environments.
